input.project_name: UPM-Bulk Fuel Delivery for 100% Capacity at WWCK & UK 2023 Call Off
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Marge Hills (2):rejected by Marge Hills (3):offer submitted by Marge Hills

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
Warwick:
The location currently has enough fuel to provide 48 hours however the bulk tank still has the capacity for an additional 20,000 litres. As we are approaching a difficult period it has been requested to look at filling the Bulk Tank on site to provide 72 hours of run time.


UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour,):
Both sites will require bulk fuel deliveries throughout 2023 to ensure there is sufficient runtime afforded for all generator and DRUPS employed at each location to support critical IT equipment as required.
scope_of_work.scope:
Warwick:
Specialist Supplier to provide 20,000 litres of Fuel to Kyndryl Warwick. Fuel to be transported to the location and pumped into the BST 2 Tank within the critical plant area.

UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour):
This LSE will be raised to allow sites to order bulk fuel deliveries when required.
scope_of_work.justification:
Warwick:
If there is a prolonged outage on site this fuel delivery will assist with supporting the locations critical infrastructure for a longer period, reducing risk of outages.

UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour):
This LSE will provide a more streamlined approach, will prevent hold ups when requiring additional fuel deliveries for the UK sites and will prevent additional administrative work.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect:
Warwick:
There would be a reduced time on what the site is capable of supplying if we were to run on Generators for prolonged periods.

UK Sites for 2023 (Warwick & North Harbour):
If there is no fuel available systems will not continue to support critical IT equipment as required. If an LSQ is raised every time fuel is required, it will cause delays adding risk to the potential of power failure to critical equipment.

input.associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (No), EANS/CMMS Update (Yes), O&M Manuals (No), Job Punch List (No), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (No), Single Source Approval (Yes), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Terence Murray MD (2):offer approved by Terence Murray MD (3):offer submitted by Terence Murray MD

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.scope:
1. Carry out safety checks before commencing works.
2. Refrigerant recovery.
3. Disconnect compressor electrical and mechanical connections ready for compressor removal.
4. Sub-contractor to attend site to remove faulty compressor and replace with a 
remanufactured compressor (Service Exchange). Faulty compressor to be removed from site as a part of the service exchange.
5. JCI to reconnect mechanical and electrical connections.
6. Pressure test the compressor connections using oxygen free nitrogen to ensure no leaks.
7. Evacuate the system to a suitable Torr reading and complete a vacuum rise test.
8. Charge the system with fresh R134a refrigerant.
9. Remove system isolations and allow oil temperature to reach setpoint.
10. Carry out operational checks to system 2 on completion of the repairs.
11. Update site F-Gas records on completion of the repairs.
12. Digital Service Report to be issued on completion.
scope_of_work.justification: Chiller 2B2 is required to be operational to maintain the site's chilled water supply resilience level.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Continued reduction of the the site's chilled water supply resilience level. Increased risk to the site critical IT Load.

output.project_scope:
The scope notes highlight key considerations: 1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process. The problem statement indicates: Chiller 2B2 compressor has failed.. The defined scope of work includes: 1. Carry out safety checks before commencing works.
2. Refrigerant recovery.
3. Disconnect compressor electrical and mechanical connections ready for compressor removal.
4. Sub-contractor to attend site to remove faulty compressor and replace with a 
remanufactured compressor (Service Exchange). Faulty compressor to be removed from site as a part of the service exchange.
5. JCI to reconnect mechanical and electrical connections.
6. Pressure test the compressor connections using oxygen free nitrogen to ensure no leaks.
7. Evacuate the system to a suitable Torr reading and complete a vacuum rise test.
8. Charge the system with fresh R134a refrigerant.
9. Remove system isolations and allow oil temperature to reach setpoint.
10. Carry out operational checks to system 2 on completion of the repairs.
11. Update site F-Gas records on completion of the repairs.
12. Digital Service Report to be issued on completion.. The justification provided is: Chiller 2B2 is required to be operational to maintain the site's chilled water supply resilience level.. If not approved, the effect would be: Continued reduction of the the site's chilled water supply resilience level. Increased risk to the site critical IT Load..

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Prof. Miracle Abshire (2):offer submitted by Prof. Miracle Abshire

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Primary chilled water pump replacement due to not being done during the RER project due to IBM funding and is now coming to the end of its working life
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend CBRE office for induction
Sign relevant paperwork 
Remove the existing Worthington Simpson belt drive pump
Install 1no Grundfos NB end suction pump to be supplied by customer
Remove existing pipework and NRVs, back to the current Isolation Valves
Install all new pipework, bellows, NRVs and gasket, to be supplied by customer
Make all mechanical and electrical connections
Test and commission
Arrange for the lagging to be reinstalled or replaced where necessary
scope_of_work.justification:
To complete upgrade works to chilled water pumps started during RER project and stopped due to IBM funding. 
To maintain N+1 on the primary chilled water system PCW pump 3 is running hot and is at the end of its working life as it was installed in 1989"
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: To maintain N+1 on the primary chilled water system PCW pump 3 is running hot and is at the end of its working life as it was installed in 1989

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Flo Hodkiewicz

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: FET (Fixed electrical testing) is used to ensure the safety and compliance of electrical installations in accordance with UK health and safety law. It involves the testing and inspection of all electrical wiring and systems between the incoming electrical supply and final circuits within a building. On IRS Building Services Distribution Boards, across the site we have elapsed or are coming to our 5 year due date, to undertake our FET testing.
scope_of_work.scope: Specialist Contractor (Drakeset) will have 2 x Operatives, attend site to FET Test 225 circuits within IRS Building Services Distribution Boards. This includes checking main panels, distribution boards, lights, plug sockets and air conditioning, it does not include equipment that is plugged in. Testing involves visual inspections and electrical tests on all systems in the building. All circuits should have a - insulation resistance test, a R1 R2 test, A Earth Loop Test & a PFC Test. Circuits shall be identified and isolated for dead tests to take place, then reinstated for live tests. On dual feed equipment and in critical areas we shall follow a FSP, and isolate dual fed circuits so, point of test is safe to do so.
scope_of_work.justification: Fixed wire testing checks the condition of the electrics against the UK standard for the safety of electrical installations, BS 7671. Each circuit’s cable and accessories is inspected for visual damage and wear and tear, followed by a series of tests to verify the wiring is safe and the circuit is wired correctly. Failure to have an up-to-date EICR means you cannot prove you have undertaken the legally required assessment. This means you may be liable for any electrical accident and be at risk of prosecution.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Fixed wire testing checks the condition of the electrics against the UK standard for the safety of electrical installations, BS 7671. Each circuit’s cable and accessories is inspected for visual damage and wear and tear, followed by a series of tests to verify the wiring is safe and the circuit is wired correctly. Failure to have an up-to-date EICR means you cannot prove you have undertaken the legally required assessment. This means you may be liable for any electrical accident and be at risk of prosecution.

input.project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick MP13 WAPS & Security Printer Cabling
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Miss Maymie Sporer

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
4. Detailed scope highlights the work to be undertaken as part of this LSQ
scope_of_work.problem: CIO have requested Cat6a SFTP Cabling is to be installed from the Kyndryl LAN Room 1G2 to the MP13 Office area to supply the 2 x WAPS in this area and also to supply the Kyndryl Security Printer from the 1G2 LAN to separate these items from the IBM Network. This is all part of the IBM/Kyndryl Separation
scope_of_work.scope:
Supply and install 1 x 80mtrs Cat6a SFTP Cable from an agreed position within MP13 to
an existing Data Cabinet (TBC) located within LAN Room 1G2.
Supply and install 1 x 90mtrs Cat6a SFTP Cable from an agreed position within MP13 to
an existing Data Cabinet (TBC) located within LAN Room 1G2
The 2 x Cat6a SFTP Cable will be installed at High level and secured where possible
onto the existing cable containment infrastructure along the cable route.
1 x Standard RJ45/C6A field plug termination at the WAP module position for each cable
1 x Female C6A termination at the Patch Panel position for each cable
Supply and install 1 x 30mtrs Cat6a SFTP Cable from an agreed position above the Reception Desk within the ceiling void to the Security Control Room Printer and terminate each end with 1 x Standard RJ45/C6A
The Cat6a SFTP new printer Cable will be installed at High level and secured where
possible onto the existing cable containment infrastructure along the cable route
between Reception and Security Control Room.
scope_of_work.justification: If this works is not performed then the Networks IBM/Kyndryl at the location will not be able to be split appropriately
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: As per Justification - The Networks at the location will not be able to be split leaving Kyndryl WAPS/Printers on the IBM Network
